Job Details

Safety Supervisor Job Description

  • Develop and Implement Safety Policies and Procedures
  • Create comprehensive safety documentation, including manuals, protocols, and training materials.
  • Ensure all safety procedures align with company policies and regulatory requirements.
  • Maintain a thorough understanding of OSHA standards and regulations.
  • Conduct regular audits and inspections to ensure compliance with OSHA and other relevant safety standards.
  • Address and rectify any non-compliance issues promptly.
  • Design and conduct safety training programs for employees at all levels.
  • Ensure all employees are educated on safety protocols and emergency procedures.
  • Lead investigations of accidents and incidents to determine root causes.
  • Develop and implement corrective actions to prevent future incidents.
  • Prepare and submit detailed reports on incidents and safety violations.
  • Conduct regular risk assessments to identify potential hazards in the manufacturing environment.
  • Implement proactive measures to mitigate risks and enhance workplace safety.
  • Monitor and analyze safety performance metrics to identify areas for improvement.
  • Stay updated on industry best practices and integrate them into the company’s safety programs.
  • Work closely with other departments to ensure safety protocols are integrated into daily operations.
  • Communicate safety policies and updates to all employees clearly and effectively.
  • Develop and implement emergency response plans.
  • Coordinate regular emergency drills to ensure readiness for various scenarios.
